item.title: TAMUctf 2020 - Russian Nesting Doll
item.description: 1. Introduction This is my second writeup for this year’s TAMUctf challenges. It’s about the “RUSSIAN_NESTING_DOLL” challenge that came under the “MISC” category. We will be analyzing some suspicious network traffic in order to extract the information that was exfiltrated. Category Name Solves Points Misc Russian Nesting Doll +65 ~444 2. Challenge description Our monitoring systems noticed some funny-looking DNS traffic on one of our computers.

item.title: TAMUctf 2020 - Helpful Builder
item.description: 1. Introduction As usual, TAMUctf brought us a new variety of fun challenges this year. The CTF was really fun to play, and the infrastructure was good. (thanks to the organizers!) One of these challenges was the “HELPFUL_BUILDER” challenge from the category “NETWORK_PENTEST", this is gonna be my approach of solving the challenge. Category Name Solves Points Network/Pentest Helpful Builder 28 490 2.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Feel free to contact me via LinkedIn or e-mail. E-mail: gh_zouahi@esi.dz LinkedIn: @hafidh-zouahi

item.title: About
item.description: # whoami My name is Hafidh, I’m currently studying Computer Science at the Higher National School of Computer Science (Algiers). (ESI ex. INI) I’m passionate about Cyber Security and everything that involves understanding the inner workings of things and breaking them. CTF player I started playing CTFs1 since I got introduced into the amazing field of Cyber Security. I was skipping studies and homeworks to play CTFs whenever I could, this became an essential part of my life as it teaches a lot about Information Security and other esoteric topics.
